tool.name: Get-subseq
tool.description: Extract sub-sequences from new draft rice genomes
tool.command: #if str($reference.source) != "indexed": mkdir index_dir && ln -s $reference.own_file index_dir/genome.fa && /usr/local/bin/samtools faidx index_dir/genome.fa && /usr/local/bin/samtools faidx index_dir/genome.fa '$scaffold':'$sstart'-'$sstop' > '$output' && rm -rf index_dir #else: /usr/local/bin/samtools faidx '$reference.index.fields.path' '$scaffold':'$sstart'-'$sstop' > '$output' #end if

param.name: source
param.label: Will you select a reference genome from your history or use a built-in index?
param.help: Built-ins were indexed using default options. See `Indexes` section of help below
param.option: Use a genome from the history and build index

param.name: index
param.label: Select reference genome
param.help: If your genome of interest is not listed, contact the IRRI-Galaxy team: v.juanillas@irri.org

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Get_subseq - what it does**
This tool extracts a subsequence of interest from the 3 recently published draft genomes (DJ123 - aus, IR64 - indica: Schatz et al, 2014 and Kasalath - aus: Sakai et al 2014).
Usually, you would align a query sequence to these genomes using the Find-seq tool, then extract the subsequence of choice from the alignment output using this tool.
The scaffold / chromosome name spelling is important. Pls check the alignment output for the correct scaffold name to use (scaffold_nn or chr0n ...). DO NOT include the ">" sign for contig names, this is an artifact from the FASTA header name.
Samtools_ faidx is used to extract subsequences from the genome FASTA file...
.. _Samtools: http://samtools.sourceforge.net/samtools.shtml
